newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Sevel gives Peugeot option to take control.
newsitem.headline: Sevel gives Peugeot option to take control.

text.p: Sevel Argentina on Wednesday said it granted the French carmaker Automobiles Peugeot an option to take control of the company.
The option runs until July 1999, Francisco Macri, president of Sevel's holding company Grupo Macri, told the Buenos Aires Exchange.
Sevel produces cars in Argentina under license from Peugeot, a division of PSA Peugeot Citroen.

Earlier in the day, Peugeot announced in Paris that it agreed to take an initial 15 percent of Sevel for $35 milllion through a capital increase. It said it planned to raise its stake to 23 percent next year for about the same amount.

"Grupo Macri will grant (Automobiles Peugeot) a buy option until July 15, 1999, of the number of Sevel shares that may be necessary for AP...to get a 50 percent of the capital and voting power of the mentioned company, plus one share with voting power," Macri said.
